text: Bottle - Light boozy rice notes. Clear pale gold. Light bready yeast, nice acidity and alcohol heat.

My bottle is smaller and with red glass but for all I can tell this is indeed the same sake. Clear pour slight mineral tinge. Nose is light honey and stone fruit. Tastes of stone fruit, floral, honey, tangerine candy. Little syrupy and watery. Smal hints of alcohol but more rice milk on finish.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing!

Pours clear colourless, no head. Aroma of medium dry mellows, not too sweet. Taste of medium dry yellow fruits, boozy, clear rice, burning alcohol, overall nice!

Bottle from The Whisky Exchange. Fresh smooth fruity beginning. Very smooth, extremely fragile. Fantastic hints of pears and smooth rice. Great fragile light, highly drinkable. Fantastic clear and smooth pears and yellow fruits. Excellent!!
I had this one quite a while ago, in a restaurant in KL, with few notes taken. This was a fruity one, better and much more fun than the first Niigata one we had. Shameless rating for the tick.
Bottle at Sommelier. Clear pale champagne color. Aroma of faint bubblegum, a little plastic. Tastes a little alcoholic, sweet with grainy notes. Oily texture, a little phenolic finish. Nice.

Bottle pour into paper cup on the streets of Kyoto. Clear pour. Nose is jasmine, thick honey. Mouthfeel is medium, well-rounded, pretty solid. Taste is honey, sweet flowers, slightly gamey/pollen heavy. Still, very good.

Bottle from Seiyu. Slightly yellow tint, rather watery looking. Dry, subdued nose, citrus fruit, apricots, minerals. Light and dry, yet very fruity with a nice light sweetness. Light and thin, nice flavor, in that typical dry Niigata way. Good, though I prefer more body.

Bottle. Clear yellowish white color. Woody, stems, very faint alcohol in aroma. Plums, sweet, slight lemon in taste. Lemongrass in aftertaste. Im not an expert on sake so no idea how good or bad it is.

Bottle (Sushi Plaza, Tallinn)
Watery appearance. Blandish sake aroma, a bit dirty and dusty. Flat watery palate, some alcohol heat. Sweet ricey taste. Does cover the 16%. Does nothing for me. Sweet and bland.
Bottle at craigs. Pours like water, nose is floral, light pineapple, taste is light fruit, dry.
Greasy clear with even greasier golden lacing. Bright boozy bubblegum and tutti frutti but very faint. Taste is itchy lemongrass and faint gritty rice. Boozy enough, rich white spirit clinginess.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2015 bottle at home ...clear ... soft fruit ..light pineapple nose ... alcohol... rice .. soft fruits .. light pineapple ... soft sweet rice ... light dry finish

Bottle at home... Clear... No head... Big raw alcohol big pineapple fruits nose... Big alcohol.. Some petrol tones... Juicy pineapple fruits.. Long rice.. Light dry fruits 3.4
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear with no head. Aromas of. Light floral pineapple. Taste is hot, rice wine. Finishes hot.

Crystal clear, very thick clear legs. The nose is sweet and eligant with notes of lemongrass, grapes, bubblegum and a pleasant spring floral freshness. The air smells much fresher coming from my glass than what Im breathing in around me. The flavor is light with some earthy rice notes but moreover a subtle alcohol, tons of umami and a very crisp and clean with a light bitter snap in the tail. The finish is clean and bright with melon notes. This is a very fine and beautiful sake. Alcohol is present but not overly so; only there to add some fruitiness.
